question.title: Java Swing - JComboBox getSelectedItem() not finding the object (cannot be resolved)
question.body:
I'm making a simple budget calculator tool, where I have a couple input boxes, and a JComboBox to select /week, /month, or /year

I assumed I could just call getSelectedItem() on foodRateBox to get the selected item like I can with getting the text from a field such as foodField using getText(), but when I try it, I get:

"foodRateBox cannot be resolved Java(570425394)"

What am I missing?

Basic stuff:

public class BudgetBase extends JPanel {    // based on Swing JPanel

    JFrame topLevelFrame;  // top-level JFrame
    GridBagConstraints layoutConstraints = new GridBagConstraints(); // layout

    private JButton calculateButton;   // Calculate button
    private JButton exitButton;        // Exit button

    private JTextField wagesField;     // Wages text field
    private JTextField loansField;     // Loans text field
    private JTextField otherIncomeField;     // text field for anyhting else
    private JTextField totalIncomeField; // Total Income field

    private JTextField foodField;   // food text field
    private JTextField rentField;   // rent text field
    private JTextField otherSpendingField;  // text field for anyhting else
    private JTextField totalSpendingField;  // Total Spending field

    private JTextField deficitField; // difference between spending and income
    String[] rate = {"/week", "/month", "/year"};   // selection for the JComboBoxes
...

Then I have a function for the components and adding them to the gridbag

private void initComponents() { 

    ...

// Row 1 - Wages label, box, and text field
    JLabel wagesLabel = new JLabel("Wages");
    addComponent(wagesLabel, 1, 0);

    final JComboBox<String> wagesRateBox = new JComboBox<String>(rate);
    addComponent(wagesRateBox, 1, 1);

    wagesField = new JTextField("", 10);   // blank initially, with 10 columns
    wagesField.setHorizontalAlignment(JTextField.RIGHT) ;  
    addComponent(wagesField, 1, 2); 

    ...

When the calculate button is pressed, it calls a function to do some calculations and this is where I want to get the item in the JComboBox.

public double calculateTotalSpending() {

    // get values from spendng text fields.  valie is NaN if an error occurs
    String spendingError = "";    // track errors to output as one message
    double food = getTextFieldValue(foodField);
    double rent = getTextFieldValue(rentField);
    double otherS = getTextFieldValue(otherSpendingField);    //otherS for 'Other Spending'

    String foodRate = foodRateBox.getSelectedItem();

    ...

getTextFieldValue is just this:

private double getTextFieldValue(JTextField field) {

    // get value as String from field
    String fieldString = field.getText();  // get text from text field

    if ((fieldString.trim()).equals("")) {   // if text field is blank, return 0
        return 0.0;
    } 

    else {  // if text field is not blank, parse it into a double
        try {
            return Double.parseDouble(fieldString);  // parse field number into a double
         } catch (java.lang.NumberFormatException ex) {  // catch invalid number exception
            return Double.NaN;  // return NaN to show that field is not a number
        }
    }
}

answers.body:
I don't know who approved the publication, but the code you show doesn't compile... Let's look at some problems:

  1. Class attributes:
public class BudgetBase extends JPanel {   
    JFrame topLevelFrame;  // top-level JFrame
    GridBagConstraints layoutConstraints = new GridBagConstraints(); 
    private JButton calculateButton;   
    private JButton exitButton; 
    private JTextField wagesField;  
    private JTextField loansField;   
    private JTextField otherIncomeField;   
    private JTextField totalIncomeField; 
    private JTextField foodField; 
    private JTextField rentField;  
    private JTextField otherSpendingField;  
    private JTextField totalSpendingField;  
    private JTextField deficitField; 
    String[] rate = {“/week”, “/month”, “/year”};

wagesRateBox does not appear here, so in the calculateTotalSpending method, on the line String foodRate = foodRateBox.getSelectedItem();, I get a warning:

cannot find symbol
 symbol: variable foodRateBox
 location: class BudgetBase
  1. the JComboBox that does appear
private void initComponents() { 
      // I omit the other lines
    final JComboBox<String> wagesRateBox = new JComboBox<String>(rate);
}

Here it does appear as wagesRateBox (Should wagesRateBox be foodRateBox?), but not as an attribute, so it is only visible within this method.

A first step would be to declare foodRateBox as an attribute, but then another problem arises: the line String foodRate = foodRateBox.getSelectedItem(); gives me the error:

incompatible types: Object cannot be converted to String

because getSelectedItem() returns an Object, so the corresponding casting must be done.

question_comments.body: The Double.NaN stuff looks dangerous. You're going at least partly down the road of hiding errors when you should be presenting them clearly to the user

Comment from MarsAtomic (copied from Staging Ground): You're using some IDE to do UI development, but if you really want to learn Swing, you should be coding by hand. At this point, tools will only confuse you. If you coded by hand, you would have noticed that your foodRateBox JComboBox isn't declared, much less instantiated, anywhere in your code.
